name: market for stone groundwood pulp | stone groundwood pulp | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/1914/documentation

This is a market activity. Each market represents the consumption mix of a product in a given geography, connecting suppliers with consumers of the same product in the same geographical area. Markets group the producers and also the imports of the product (if relevant) within the same geographical area. They also account for transport to the consumer and for the losses during that process, when relevant.;This is the market for  'stone groundwood pulp', in the Global geography.;This product is generally considered to be used at the production site.  Therefore, the market does not contain any transport.;The product “stone groundwood pulp” (SGW) is a type of bleached, mechanical, wood-containing pulp. Mechanical pulp is weaker than chemical pulp (sulfate and sulfite pulp) but has a higher light-scattering coefficients and opacity. For the production of SGW pulp, wood logs are pressed against a rotating grinder stone with simultaneous addition of water. The majority of mechanical pulp is produced at integrated pulp mills which directly process it further into (paper-) products and only a minor part of pulp production is sold on the market. SGW pulp is mainly used for Printing & writing papers and newsprint. 

This activity starts at the gate of the activities that produce 'stone groundwood pulp',  within the geography of Global.

This activity ends with the supply of  stone groundwood pulp', to the consumers of this product. Transport or losses are considered irrelevant for this product.
